Awareness of the potential threat posed by this species to native biodiversity must be raised. The Venezuelan government has taken actions to avoid the spread of this species. There has been an eradication program, with participants from the University of Los Andes at Mérida, the Venezuelan Institute of Scientific Research (IVIC) and the Ministry of Environment, instated at the beginning of 2002.

rationale: <span data-sheets-value="{"1":2,"2":"Listed as Critically Endangered because its extent of occurrence (EOO) is [XXX] km2, it is considered to occur in one threat-defined location, and there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat in [location]."}" data-sheets-userformat="{"2":13245,"3":{"1":0},"5":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"6":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"7":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"8":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"10":0,"11":4,"12":0,"15":"Calibri","16":11}">Listed as Critically Endangered because its extent of occurrence (EOO) is 10 km<sup>2</sup>, it is considered to occur in one threat-defined location, and there is continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat at its only known locality in the western Andean slopes of central Ecuador.
habitat: It can be found in the upper humid montane forest. Individuals have been found by day inside bromeliads at 2–4 m above the ground, in forests and on scattered trees within pastures (Lynch 1979, Páez and Ron 2019). It breeds by direct development and the egg deposition site is not known.
threats: There is ongoing habitat loss at its only known locality due to human settlements and cattle raising (Páez and Ron 2019).
population: <span data-sheets-value="{"1":2,"2":"A decreasing population trend is inferred from the ongoing decline in the quality and extent of this species' habitat."}" data-sheets-userformat="{"2":13247,"3":{"1":0},"4":[null,2,16773836],"5":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"6":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"7":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"8":{"1":[{"1":2,"2":0,"5":[null,2,0]},{"1":0,"2":0,"3":3},{"1":1,"2":0,"4":1}]},"10":0,"11":4,"12":0,"15":"Calibri","16":11}" data-sheets-textstyleruns="{"1":0}[null,33,{"5":1}]{"1":41}">A decreasing population trend is inferred from the ongoing decline in the quality and extent of this species' habitat at its only known locality.
range:
This species was formerly considered to be distributed along the western and eastern Andean slopes of Ecuador and Peru, from 1,800–3,100 m asl. However, a taxonomic assessment by Páez and Ron (2019) revealed that most records previously ascribed to this species actually represent other species [(e.g., Pristimantis atillo, P. jimenezi, P. teslai, P. torresi, P. totoroi, P. verrucolatus, Pristimantis sp. (CCS2), Pristimantis sp. (UCS2), Pristimantis sp. (UCS3)]. Sequences of “P. phoxocephalus” from two localities of Peru (Kañaris in Ferrenafe Province, Warmicocha-Cochapamba road in Chachapoyas Province) were also analysed; they do not belong to the subgenus Huicundomantis and likely represent an undescribed species (Páez and Ron 2019). 

This species is now restricted to a single locality, Pilaló, in the western Andean slopes of central Ecuador, at 2,340–2,820 m asl. For the purposes of this assessment, the records of Pristimantis sp. (CCS2), Pristimantis sp. (UCS2), Pristimantis sp. (UCS3) and the two Peru localities are retained under this concept, but classified as Presence Uncertain, until they can be formally allocated to other species. The extent of occurrence (EOO) of its extant range is 10 km2, which represents one or fewer threat-defined location.
useTrade: There are no records of the species being utilized.
conservationActions:
Conservation Actions In-Place
Its type locality is not within any protected area.

Conservation Needed
Habitat protection is required at sites where this species is known to occur.

Research Needed
Further research on this species' population size, distribution and trends is recommended.
